fullDescription.intro: Load data into a DeepGreen Database Table. If the table does not exist, it will be created first. If the table already exists and append option is true, data will be appended, otherwise, table will be dropped and recreated.

tab.name: Settings
tab.option: DeepGreen Table storage option, can be lz4, zstd, or none (default).
DeepGreen Table distributed by list, or randomly (default).
Check this to append the input data to an existing table with the same schema. If this box is unchecked, existing table will be dropped and recreated.

tab.name: SQL Types
tab.option: Enter the SQL types for the table. By default integers are defined as type "integer", doubles as "double precision", and all other columns, including strings are written as "text".

ports.inPort: Table with data to write into database
